other_tests.findings: Tumor tissue was positive for ACTH, had high mitotic numbers, atypical nuclei, Ki-67 40%, p53 positive in the majority of cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After the first surgery, ACTH transiently decreased to 11 pmol/L and s-cortisol to 42 nmol/L. After subsequent treatments, ACTH remained below 100 pmol/L for 10 months, then rapidly increased to 43000 pmol/L with liver enzyme elevations.

other_tests.findings: Biopsy confirmed a pituitary origin of the liver metastases.
MRI showed a pituitary tumor eroding the floor of the sella and extending into the sphenoidal sinus.
The tumor showed unambiguous loss of MSH2 and MSH6 with retention of MLH1 and PMS2; classified as MSI-low.
